project.name: Ray Optics Simulation
project.description: A free, open-source web app for creating and simulating 2D geometric optical scenes.

homePage.description:
Create & simulate 2D geometric optical scenes interactively.
Totally free and web-based. Source code is [available on GitHub](/github).

common.circleInstruction: Drag or click to create, first the center, then the circumference.

SingleRay.title: Single ray
SingleRay.description: A single ray of light defined by two points.
SingleRay.instruction: Drag or Click to create, first the source, then the direction.

Beam.title: Beam
Beam.description: A parallel or divergent beam of rays emerges from a line segment, with density controlled by the 'Ray density' slider.

PointSource.title: Point source
PointSource.description: Rays emerge from a single point, with number controlled by the 'Ray density' slider.

AngleSource.instruction: Drag or Click to create, first the source, then the direction.
AngleSource.description: Point source with a given emission angle.

Mirror.title: Segment
Mirror.description: Simulate the reflection of light on a mirror.

otherMirror.title: Curved
otherMirror.description: A mirror whose shape is curved. Can be circular, parabolic, or defined by a custom equation y = f(x).

ArcMirror.title: Circular Arc
ArcMirror.description: A mirror whose shape is part of a circle, which is defined by three points.
ArcMirror.instruction: Drag or click the two endpoints to create, then click a third point on the arc to define the curvature.

ParabolicMirror.title: Parabolic
ParabolicMirror.description: A mirror whose shape is a parabola, which is defined by three points.
ParabolicMirror.instruction: Drag or click the two endpoints to create, then click the vertex.

IdealMirror.title: Ideal curved mirror
IdealMirror.description: The idealized 'curved' mirror which obeys exactly the mirror equation (1/p + 1/q = 1/f). The focal length can be set directly.

BeamSplitter.title: Beam Splitter
BeamSplitter.description: A mirror that transmits a percentage of incoming light.

CustomMirror.title: Custom Equation
CustomMirror.description: A mirror whose shape is defined by a custom equation y = f(x), where (x,y) is in the transformed coordinates in which the two control points are (-1,0) and (1,0).

ParamMirror.title: Parametric Curve
ParamMirror.description: A mirror whose shape is defined by custom parametric equations.

ConcaveDiffractionGrating.title: Concave Grating
ConcaveDiffractionGrating.description: A concave diffraction grating whose shape is part of a circle.

PlaneGlass.title: Half-plane
PlaneGlass.description: Simulate the refraction and reflection of light on a surface.
PlaneGlass.instruction: Drag or click two points on the surface to create.

otherGlass.title: Other shapes
otherGlass.description: Glass with any shapes constructed from line segments and circular arcs, or shapes defined by a custom inequality f(x) < y < g(x).

CircleGlass.title: Circle
CircleGlass.description: Glass with a circle shape, defined by its center and a point on the surface.

Glass.title: Polygon / Circular Arcs
Glass.description: Glass with any shapes constructed from line segments and circular arcs.
Glass.instruction: Click to create a segment, drag to create an arc, click on the starting point when finish drawing.

IdealLens.title: Ideal Lens
IdealLens.description: An ideal lens which obeys exactly the thin lens equation (1/p + 1/q = 1/f). The focal length can be set directly.

SphericalLens.title: Spherical Lens
SphericalLens.description: A spherical lens, whose shape can be defined using various parameters.

CustomGlass.title: Custom Equation
CustomGlass.description: Glass with the shape defined by a custom inequality f(x) < y < g(x), where (x,y) is in the transformed coordinates in which the two control points are (-1,0) and (1,0).

ParamGlass.title: Parametric Curve
ParamGlass.description: Glass with the shape defined by custom parametric equations.

CurveGlass.title: Bézier Curves
CurveGlass.description: Glass bounded by cubic Bézier curves.
CurveGlass.instruction: Click to create a piece, click on the starting point when finish drawing. After that, drag the boxes to manipulate the control points, changing the curve.

CircleGrinGlass.title: GRIN Circle
CircleGrinGlass.description: Glass with a custom refractive index function n(x,y) and a circular boundary.

GrinGlass.title: GRIN Polygon
GrinGlass.description: Glass with a custom refractive index function n(x,y) and a polygonal boundary.
GrinGlass.instruction: Click to create a segment, click on the starting point when finish drawing.
GrinGlass.warning: WARNING: Only simple polygons are supported, otherwise the behavior is unpredictable.

ParamGrinGlass.title: GRIN Parametric Curve
ParamGrinGlass.description: Gradient-index glass with boundary defined by custom parametric equations.

CurveGrinGlass.title: GRIN Bézier Curves
CurveGrinGlass.description: Gradient-index glass bounded by cubic Bézier curves.

otherGrinGlass.title: Gradient-index glass
otherGrinGlass.description: Material with a custom refractive index function n(x,y).

Blocker.title: Line Blocker
Blocker.description: A line-segment light blocker which absorbs the incident rays.

CircleBlocker.title: Circle Blocker
CircleBlocker.description: A circle light blocker which absorbs the incident rays.

Aperture.title: Aperture
Aperture.description: A pair of light blockers which absorbs the incident rays. The size of the hole can be adjusted symmetrically.
Aperture.instruction: Drag or click the two endpoints to create.

DiffractionGrating.title: Diffraction Grating
DiffractionGrating.description: A diffraction grating that splits light at an angle depending on wavelength.
DiffractionGrating.warning: Warning: The intensities of diffracted rays may not be accurate.

Ruler.title: Ruler
Ruler.description: A ruler from a point for zero and another point.

Protractor.title: Protractor
Protractor.description: A protractor defined from the center and another point for the zero direction. The scale is in degrees.

Detector.title: Detector
Detector.description: A tool for measuring the rate of energy flow (P), the rate of perpendicular momentum flow (F⊥), and the rate of parallel momentum flow (F∥) through a line segment.  The units are arbitrary.

CustomSurface.title: Custom Line Surface
CustomSurface.description: A custom line-segment surface where the angles (θ) and brightnesses (P) of the outgoing rays (when a ray is incident on it) are defined by custom equations.

CustomArcSurface.title: Custom Arc Surface
CustomArcSurface.description: A custom surface with shape of a circular arc.

CustomParamSurface.title: Custom Parametric Curve
CustomParamSurface.description: A custom surface with shape defined by parametric equations.

moveView.title: Move view
moveView.description: Drag to move the view. (Mouse right button drag has the same function.)

view.title: View

rays.title: Rays
rays.description: Show the rays. When the 'Ray density' is high, they appear to be continuous.

extended.title: Extended rays
extended.description: Show both the rays and its extension. Orange indicates backward extensions, and gray indicates forward ones.
extended.simulateColorsNote: When 'Simulate Colors' is on, they are shown in source colors and distinguished by dashing instead.

images.title: All Images
images.description: Show the position of all images. Yellow points indicate real images, orange indicates virtual images, and gray (none in this picture) indicates virtual objects. Note that some images cannot be detected if 'Ray density' is not high enough.
images.simulateColorsNote: When 'Simulate Colors' is on, they are shown in source colors and distinguished by dot sizes instead.

observer.title: Seen by Observer
observer.description: Simulate the rays and images seen from some position. The blue circle is the observer. Any rays crossing it are considered to be 'observed'. The observer does not know where the rays actually begin, but may think they begin at some point(s) if they intersect there. The rays are shown in blue, and the points in yellow (real) or orange (virtual).
observer.simulateColorsNote: When 'Simulate Colors' is on, they are shown in source colors instead.
observer.instruction: Drag the big blue dot to move the observer.

view.customThemeNote: Note: This scene uses a custom theme.

simulateColors.title: Simulate Colors
simulateColors.description: Simulate colors (wavelengths) of light sources, mixture of colors, color filtering of blockers and mirrors, and chromatic dispersion of glasses.
simulateColors.instruction: You can set those parameters for those objects when selected. To simulate color spectra, overlap rays with different wavelengths.
simulateColors.warning: Color mixing is inaccurate unless used with "Correct Brightness".
